dublin_core.dcvalue: Risk perception is determined by parameters related to the nature of the risk as well as inherent to the individual perceiving this risk This study was designed to provide a better understanding of the role of personality especially anxiety traits on risk perception It compared representations of two different risks smoking with known and generally accepted adverse health effects and cell phones whose hazardous potency is still controversial each presented in two different forms of exposure active smokers and cell phone users and passive passive smoking and exposure to cell phone masts
Made available in DSpace on 2020-02-06T18:56:16Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 0 Previous issue date: 2014-04-07
Revue d'épidémiologie et de santé publique
The role of anxiety in the perception of technological hazards - a cross-sectional study on cell phones and masts.
